techmeme.title: Stigg, which helps companies modernize their payment and billing infrastructure, raised a $17.5M Series A led by Red Dot, taking its total funding to $24M (Mike Wheatley/SiliconANGLE)
Filing: Samsung accuses India's competition watchdog of unlawfully detaining its employees and seizing data in a 2022 antitrust raid tied to Amazon and Flipkart (Reuters)
Zürich-based robotics startup Anybotics raised a $60M Series B extension, taking the round, announced in May 2023, to $110M and its total funding to $130M (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
Current and former Netflix staff say the company has walked back its parental-leave benefits, after shifting its focus from subscriber growth to profitability (Jessica Toonkel/Wall Street Journal)
Sources: Xiaohongshu, the Instagram-like app popular with younger Chinese users, told investors it will double profit to $1B+ in 2024, ahead of a potential IPO (Bloomberg)
